snippet: An agreement between the Thai government and the Barisan Revolusi Nasional to hold negotiations was a hopeful but tentative sign that tensions may ease in a deadly insurgency.
abstract: Thai government agrees to hold peace talks with rebel group Barisan Revolusi Nasional in what analysts say is tentative but hopeful sign that tensions may ease in insurgency that has left 5,000 people dead.
lead_paragraph: An agreement between the Thai government and the Barisan Revolusi Nasional to hold negotiations was a hopeful but tentative sign that tensions may ease in a deadly insurgency.

headline.seo: Thailand to Hold Peace Talks With Rebel Group
headline.main: Thais to Hold Peace Talks With Rebels
headline.print_headline: Thais to Hold Peace Talks With Rebels
